skill.name: gget
skill.description: CLI/Python toolkit for rapid bioinformatics queries. Preferred for quick BLAST searches. Access to 20+ databases: gene info (Ensembl/UniProt), AlphaFold, ARCHS4, Enrichr, OpenTargets, COSMIC, genome downloads. For advanced BLAST/batch processing, use biopython. For multi-database integration, use bioservices.
skill.summary: CLI/Python toolkit for rapid bioinformatics queries. Preferred for quick BLAST searches. Access to 2...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, data exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Code focuses on bioinformatics workflows and local file outputs with expected network use via gget.

content.value_statement: Bioinformatics queries often require many tools and formats. This skill unifies common gene, sequence, and enrichment tasks into simple workflows.
actual_capabilities: Search genes and retrieve Ensembl IDs with gget search
Fetch gene metadata and PDB links with gget info
Download nucleotide or protein sequences with gget seq
Run BLAST queries and save hit tables
Perform enrichment analysis with Enrichr and save CSV outputs
Query expression and disease associations with ARCHS4 and OpenTargets
limitations: Requires gget installed in the runtime environment
Many modules need network access to external databases
AlphaFold, cellxgene, and ELM require setup downloads
COSMIC queries need a licensed database download and credentials

use_cases.title: Quick gene profile
use_cases.description: Look up a gene, pull sequences, and summarize expression and disease links.

use_cases.title: Batch sequence workflow
use_cases.description: Run BLAST and alignment across many sequences and save results to files.

use_cases.title: Enrichment report
use_cases.description: Generate enrichment outputs and summary tables for a gene list.

prompt_templates.title: Gene overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the gene TP53 in human and save gene info, sequences, and disease associations to files.

prompt_templates.title: Batch BLAST
prompt_templates.prompt: Run batch sequence analysis on my FASTA file and save BLAST hits and alignment output.

prompt_templates.title: Enrichment pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run enrichment analysis on genes.csv for human and generate summary and expression outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a multi step workflow: search BRCA genes, fetch sequences, run enrichment, and report top pathways.

output_examples.input: Analyze BRCA1 in human and save outputs.
output: Saved gene info CSV and FASTA files
Recorded top tissues and disease links

best_practices: Use a clean virtual environment and pin gget version
Limit gene list size to avoid remote API timeouts
anti_patterns: Running AlphaFold without setup or hardware planning
Requesting COSMIC data without a licensed database
Sending large gene lists without rate limits

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works anywhere gget and Python run, including CLI and notebooks.

faq.question: What are the query limits?
faq.answer: Some APIs limit request size; keep batches small and use rate limiting.

faq.question: Can I integrate with pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts write CSV and FASTA outputs for downstream tools.

faq.question: Does it access private data?
faq.answer: No, it only reads provided files and queries public databases.

faq.question: What if a module fails?
faq.answer: Check network access, update gget, and verify input formats.

faq.question: How does it compare to Biopython?
faq.answer: gget is simpler for quick queries; Biopython is broader but more manual.
